page.title: 17Transport in Stallingborough
page.content: Most families have a private car which gives personal mobility. The road network is comprehensive and the recent building of a motorway near the village has given villagers access to a national motorway network, and relieved the village of considerable day to day traffic. For those without a car the railway provides an hourly service into Grimsby and a link with the intercity trains. For shorter trips bicycles are commonly used and occasionally taxis. The movement of Agricultural Produce is almost completely by lorries which have access to individual farms. Industrial produce is moved partly by lorries but also by a private rail link to one of the major Humber Bank factories. Although not in the survey area people in this block have easy access to air transport only 10 miles away.
